title: Font with Phonetic Arabic
content:
I am a historian, and not an expert in fonts, but I am frustrated. I am looking for an English font that has the equivalent phonetic letters to Arabic letters. Eg. A heavy T with a dot under it, a dhall or d with a line through it, etc. Is there a font similar to Garamond (for publishing purposes) that has all of these characters?

EG: Sa’īd Ibn Ḥusayn changes his title to Imām ’Abid Allāh al-Mahdī Billāh.

I find myself using multiple fonts to find all of the different characters I need. Is there one font that has them all? Perhaps an Arabic font that contains them? I prefer to purchase it so that I can use it regularly.

I am currently inquiring about Brills new font, which seems brilliant, but not available for commercial use... ie they do not want any competitors using it. Any suggestions anyone?

Dan Gibson
author: CanBooks

comments.content:
I don’t know if they have all the glyphs you need, but here are some of the most comprehensive typefaces I know.  
Andron: [http://www.signographie.de/cms/front\_content.php?idart=69](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162418/http:/www.signographie.de/cms/front_content.php?idart=69 "http://www.signographie.de/cms/front\_content.php?idart=69")  
Gentium: [http://scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site\_id=nrsi&id=Gentium](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162418/http:/scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site_id=nrsi&id=Gentium "http://scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site\_id=nrsi&id=Gentium") (maybe also others from SIL)  
Palimpsest: [http://typophile.com/node/67787](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162418/http:/typophile.com/node/67787 "http://typophile.com/node/67787") (I don’t know if it’s already available, you could contact the designer: [http://typophile.com/user/32723/contact](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162418/http:/typophile.com/user/32723/contact "http://typophile.com/user/32723/contact"))

The Google font [EB\_Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162418/https:/www.google.com/fonts/specimen/EB+Garamond) contains all the characters you need except  
`U+02E4` ` ` **ˤ** ` ` Modifier letter small reversed glottal stop  
(in case you need it).
